												If you like playing real casino games in a fake enviroment that is just as unfair as real life, this is the game for you! be aware that sometime this game can get pretty laggy so i recommend playing on the lowest visual settings. my only real problem is that it doesn't feel like it has enough games, at the time of this review there are 11 games you can play without VIP, craps, video poker, video blackjack, slots, instant keno, roulette, big 6 wheel, war, blackjack (multiple decks), poker, and bingo. there are also 2 other games you can play if you have vip, baccarat and single deck blackjack, but i have yet to play them as getting vip takes quite some work. this seems like alot at first but it gets old fast, I would like to see a variety of slots as well as some other card games like "let it ride" or "3 card poker". content:
er 22, 2016
												Just a few thoughts...Table Card Games: Good - as usual, a computer-controlled Dealer is always suspect due to the number of 'lucky' hands at just the wrong time for the Human players.Slots: Tight most of the time; stingy Bonus payouts.  These Slots could be *much* better if Players could have some interactive control over the spinning wheels.  A One-Click option to set the wheels slowing into a final landing for that spin. And/Or a Two-Click option that stops the wheels immediately.  Practice, intuition and a fast, well-chosen click would add a much-needed interactive element to these slots.  Also; change out the slot 'themes' from time to time.Other Machine Games: Okay - higher non-VIP wager limits wouldn't hurt.  Add some newer games, progressive pots, etc.Poker and Bingo are the best games here for 'avatar-to-avatar' interaction; the Poses, Emotes and other in-game actions are fun, but lag-time often ruins the timing.  Be nice if we could group a few movements together as a Macro, coupled with some pre-written text, for a 'custom-crafted' greeting.  Add BreakDancing for competitions between Ava's and some other Dance forms.Clothing, Appearance, Objects: all fun and a nice touch for the overall appearance and ambience.  Keyboard and Mouse IF are good, too.  Low stress on the fingers over extended periods.Overall: A good representaion of a Casino & Nightclub with earned VIP perks, a fun place to hang with some friends and gamble, chat and socialize.  There are stores for purchasing clothes and some wild effects, animal and critter companions, and a place where you can buy a trip with your friends to a Space Station. Lotsa gaming there, I hear.Worth your time for some light entertainment, cards and gambling.  And a free Hotel room, too.They're calling another Progressive Bingo game right now; big bucks on this one - gotta run!~Max

content:

												NIce concept--games are fairly easy to get into and out of once you get the hang of the UI.  Decent options to gain free chips for completing various tasks (and you get 250 chips every 15 minutes just for being in game)--you can also buy chips fairly inexpensively if you like as well.Only thing I wish they would add are cash games in the poker room instead of the turbo sit-and-go tournament format--since I really enjoy playing poker in real casinos this would add a lot to the game for me.No real bugs for me yet and it's free to play, so go ahead and give this game a try.

number of helpful: 4 of 8 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
, 2015
												I'll definitely recommend this to anyone who's a fan of the casino ... or at least the games you play in it.From slot machines to video poker and blackjack, to real tables of poker, blackjack, and even bingo, this game has a lot of games to play.Of course, this game does have microtransactions where you can purchase chips for yourself or your friends, plus microtransactions for some clothing items in the shops (should you like to customize your character), but it's not too bad.  I think this game pulled it off without a hitch in that regard.Unfortunately, this game is a little buggy, even out of early access.  So far, I've filed three bug reports regarding minor things in the game, but it's nothing that'll ruin your experience, and the developers update the game very quick, so you have to respect that!TL;DR: Play at the casino without using your own money = no bankruptcy.

number of helpful: 4 of 8 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
, 2015
												Fantastic game, started out buggy, but it has a full staff of devs putting out daily updates. Its easy to run with lots of customization to performance for an optimal experience. Lots of games to play, including casino favorites: Black Jack and Poker! The casino is good looking, but does have FPS issues in certain areas, however this doesn't affect the gameplay. Lots of ways to customize your character/avatar, and express yourself with in game earnings. content:
1, 2015
												I'm not sure why there are so many positive reviews for this game, because I gave it way more of a chance than I would normally for such a lackluster game.  The graphics are taxing on my hardware, despite them being at their lowest.  (for reference I can run Planetside 2 at 35FPS with this rig.)  That is beside the point though.  There is a game here, where you can go almost anywhere you'd go in a normal casino, and you get 250 free chips every 15 minutes.  The theory is solid, but the execution is inevitably boring.Walking around with 400,000 chips from my slot jackpot, I found that there was absolutely no way to splurge my money.  I played literally every game in the casino 20 or so times and still couldn't throw away my money.  That's not a bad thing, but normally in my situation, a player would be having major fun.  I think it's the fact that there is NOTHING to spend chips on aside from the crappy games that take forever to even get going.  Once I got into the VIP area, I figured all of this would be different... but the VIP area is just the same as the non-VIP area with 2 different games and the same level of boredom.  I would say the rating system kept me going, but there was no actual pride to be had with it... yeah I'm tier 12 at poker.. what do I get?  Nothing.  Tier 25?  Nothing.  Lets not delude the fact that even if there were a prize, there would be nothing to do with itIn summary, the game is a borefest with a casino skin.  If you like sitting around pretending to play poker and blackjack, then this game might be for you.  But if you are a normal human being who enjoys mental stimulation... Steer clear of this waste of time.

content:
, 2015
												I was really enjoying the game for the first 30 or so hours since I was gaining lots of chips while going back and forth between all the games, but it went all down hill when I rushed to get VIP status to write about it on my site and lost all of my chips in the process. I'm actually kind of glad I did lose all of my chips since I was able to find out how terrible the game is when you're out of chips. Even with VIP status, which doubles all of the free chips that I can earn, I just can't earn chips anymore from playing games. This was my experience when I had a lot of good luck early on in the game, imagine what it would be like to constantly lose with the chips that you begin the game with and run out not even an hour into playing. I might have even considered spending some money on a cosmetic or two, but there is no way I'd do that when the game can become boring in an instant. It doesn't help when the daily free slots has bugged out on me and not giving me any chips, even when I match three in a row. This is also the first free game that I have tried where you can't even PLAY it without having chips, unless you just want to play free poker 24/7. That would be like playing a free shooter game where it limits how many matches you can play, and losing matches decreases the amount of times you can play, until finally you are forced to buy more matches.I would change it so the free chips that you earn over time gives you a small amount even if you aren't online, even 10% of their normal value would be enough to help people off the floor. This could even earn you too many over a long period, so a chip cap should also be in place.

number of helpful: 5 of 11 people (45%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
9, 2015
												Alright, i think the time has come to write a review for this game. I started playing the game on 4th or 5th of june and Steam says that the game ran for over 432 hours. I didn't actually play for all these hours, but i still played A LOT. I have played this game for about 25 days, which means that it ran for 17+ hours on average every day. With that amount of time you can safely say that i am a hardcore gamer and enjoyed it most of the time. I also recently became a volunteer as a translator for Digital Leisure, which is the company that created this game. For a long time i was not sure if i give this game a positive or a negative review, but after the Blackjack tournament that happened last weekend i finally made my decision, but more to this later.Four Kings Casino and Slots is a casino simulation. A virtual casino where you create an avatar and play popular casino games like Blackjack, Slots, Craps, Video Poker and others. In every game, except Poker, there is a house edge like in a real casino. So, if you like gambling and losing your chips most of the time then this game could get you somewhat addicted. The game was fully released out of early access on june the 1st with many bugs, errors and easy ways for people to cheat. Especially within about the first 1-2 weeks the game was plagued by cheaters and bugs. They definitely released this game too early and after almost a month now it still feels like you are playing a beta/early access version. I still don't understand why they did that. It is free to play, so how are they making their money? First there is a shop where you can buy cosmetic items like clothes for your avatar and then you can buy chips with real money. As a new player you get 10k chips to play with, which sounds good at the beginning, but it is not a lot. You can lose them quickly if you are not careful enough. Especially for Poker players it can be painful, because the buy-in at a Poker table is 5k. So, if you lose two Poker games then you are already broke. There are some ways how you can get free chips and i will list them for you:-Every 15 minutes you can pick up 250 free chips at the chip station.-Once per day you can play at the free Poker table and only the winner can get 5k. There is only 1 free Poker table in the room, so you will have to wait and sometimes be fast, because there are many players waiting. -Every now and then there is also a free Bingo game and depending on the number of players you can win some chips. With the maximum of 40 players it is 10k if i remember correctly, but good luck winning one of these.-5 daily tasks where you get 200 chips for completing each one of them and an additional 600 if you complete them all. Most of them are very easy like using an emote, playing at the free Poker table or dancing in the nightclub.-5 weekly tasks. You get 2k for completing each one of them and right now i don't remember how much you can get when you complete them all. Some of them are ridiculous like earning 1000 RP at Keno or Slots. Don't even try if you don't have many chips. I mentioned RP and this is like a second currency in the game that allows you to buy items in the shops like clothes. You mostly earn RP by winning chips and if you earn enough within a month you can get vip status for a month, which gives you some benefits. You earn RP depending on how many chips you bet/win. There are leaderboards for every game and there is a global leaderboard that are based on the RP you earn. Players who buy chips for money have a big advantage to get to the top of the leaderboards - they are kind of pay to win since these players can max bet all the time and don't have to worry about losing the chips. There were many errors and bugs. Some of them have been more or less fixed and some games have been improved, but there are still enough that it's annoying to some degree. If you run a casino then functionality is the most important thing. In Four Kings Casino and Slots you can lose chips to bugs and this is kind of ridiculous, because there are people who pay money for their chips. Tables can glitch and become unplayable, players get kicked off tables, game crashes, disconnects and people lose some chips when things like that happen. It also happened to me that one time i didn't receive the chips for completing the daily tasks. You can request chip refunds through the bug report system in the game and most of the time they will give you back your lost chips, but not always. It happened at least twice to me that i can definitely remember where they just didn't refund the chips that i lost although i made these bug reports. Again, especially painful for the players who spent money for their chips. Within the first 2 or 3 weeks the game often felt like a chip refund simulator and not a casino simulation. It is better now, but you can still lose chips to bugs, make a chip refund request through the bug report tool and not receive the chips that you lost. I would not recommend spending money in that game unless you really don't care. If you go to a real casino they don't just kick you off the table for no reason and keep your chips. So, there was a Blackjack tournament last weekend and i saved up enough chips to play. First, Digital Leisure posted wrong information about the tournament on the Steam discussion board where they always post their information about the tournaments. For example, they wrote that the tournament would be split into segments of 2 hours each and there was also a overall leaderboard. In reality these segments were just 1 hour each. After 3 or 4 hours of the tournament running they restarted the server to make some fixes. Great timing, isn't it? Unfortunately and to my anger these "fixes" still didn't help to prevent some bugs happening. For example, if you played to the end of a 1 hour segment and let the extra time fully run out your score did not count, but if you stood up a few seconds earlier your score did count. They didn't tell us anything about that before. On the second day of the tournament i had to experience it myself where i made a score that was enough for overall 3rd place, but it didn't count because the timer fully ran out. I had a pretty high score already at 3rd place, but this one was only good enough for place 5 at the end. It also happened to other players and we made a post about it on the discussion board. A Digital Leisure employee responded in that thread and said that we should make screenshots next time. Are you kidding me? It was not our fault, it was a fault on their side. He also said that the score of ALL players in this thread would be corrected and they did, but not with mine. There was a player who had a higher score than i previously had and he posted after me. He got his score corrected, but i didn't get my score corrected. When i mentioned that they forgot me he only said that it wouldn't affect MY payout and still didn't correct my score. What a joke since before that he posted that the payouts would also be corrected by the team. At the end i only ended up at rank 5 instead of rank 3 on the overall tournament leaderboard. Their game bug cost me 2 places and a better payout. On the final day of the tournament i had 2 really, really good runs that had great potential to make the best score and reach rank 1 in the whole tournament. In one of these runs i had it for sure. My luck and my earnings were crazy this time. I was almost alone in a room sitting at an empty table to play as many hands as possible. I knew it. I saw my score, i saw the time that i had left and suddenly in the middle of these 2 runs the game disconnected me. Very strange that it exactly happened in these 2 runs. I knew what i was doing. I won about 10+ of 48 of the 1 hour tournament segments and made some 2nd and 3rd places. I barely slept this weekend, tried so hard and didn't make it to #1, because of game errors. Unbelievable and ridiculous.

content:
, 2015
												This game has real potential, and a real place in the market seeing as it is the only multiplayer poker game on steam (something we really need).And while the graphics are pretty, and the idea of the hub world where you can find all the different types of poker is fun, the game is just too shoddy in the technical side of things to be recommended.Yes, it is in early access and will improve as time goes on, that does not mean a game can be released in a such a ♥♥♥♥ state.It constantly freezes, players will disappear, it will crash unexpectedly (causing me to lose a lot of chips), and has an atrocious frame rate.Its not too good from a gameplay perspective, as nearly everyone is playing Blackjack or Texas Hold 'em so you can find barely anyone to play other games with, such as roulette. And when you do want to play Blackjack or Texas Hold 'em, all the tables are taken up!Overall, the game has real promise, but in its current state, only touch this pile of ♥♥♥♥ with a stick longer than it takes for you to find an empty blackjack table!

												The Four Kings Casino and Slots seems like a great virtual casino. But as a Mac user I'm afraid I need to give this the thumbs down on the current version. I've had issues with this game as long as I've had it. But I kept trying it every now and then. From the beginning I could only make my account and log in, and then the game kept freezing at the first loading screen. Today I managed to get past the first loading screen, but it took much longer than it should have. I didn't time it, but I'm guessing it was somewhere around 3 minutes of loading screen ... Should not be needed as I have a very high end Mac, and I don't have issues loading other games. When I for the first time did manage to get past the first loading screen I got to play the game for about 45-50 minutes before it crashed again. When trying to boot the game again I got past the first loading screen, but as I tried to enter the bingo hall the game crashed again. And now I'm writing this review. Hopefully they'll fix the Mac build in the near future. But for now, it's not worth your time to play this on a Mac. At least it's not worth it on my Mac.

number of helpful: 3 of 7 people (43%) found this review helpful
content:
r 25, 2015
												This used to be a fun and enjoyable game. It must have been, I have just over 500 hours in it. I met a lot of good people here, enjoyed playing poker and slots the most. Now I have at least four times more people on my block list than friends list. As I write this I am in the VIP room on Saturday night and none else is here, at all. The game used to have a reason to want to level up in VIP ranking, to get more free chips. VIP 3 received 1000 chips every 15 minutes, now the devs took that away and everyone gets 250. I see no reason to want to keep playing to level up for no apparent reason after all the time I spent reaching nobility. This is my opinion, but it also seems that payoffs have been drastically reduced. My wife and everyone I talked to in the game believe the same. All I know is I I used to have almost a million chips, now I have les than 10 K, and not from extreme bets. The devs seem to be doing everything possible to get people to spend money in the game. That is understandable as the game is free, at least on pc. With no incentive to want to increase level, less and less friends in the game and less chance of winning in games, I see no reason to stay in the game, much less spend money in it. As I said, this was an enjoyable way to spend time, now I'm bored of it and noone staying in it. btw, there is nothing in clothing or pets I want to buy either. So now I have decided to uninstall a game I used to enjoy a lot. Make up your own mind about the game, but I think the devs destroyed it in a money grab.Oh, did I mention the glitches, which are getting worse and not better? Nothing is as frustrating as being in a poker or even bingo game and getting booted out of it in the middle. The devs are good at refunding chips when it happens, but the idea of gambling in a casino is the chance to win money, not get your money back. You can wait 10 or more minutes for a bingo game to actually start, instead of the usual 2, if too many people didnt walk out of the game by then, leaving less than the required 3 to play. Or when you are about to win the table in poker and suddenly find yourself standing outside the table and your chips are gone, as well as your chance of winning. There are just too many reasons for me to not want to play the game anymore and not nearly enough reasons for me to want to stay in it.

number of helpful: 3 of 7 people (43%) found this review helpful
content:
2015
Early Access Review
								edit 6/10/2015: This is after the official free-to-play launch (no longer in early access): The game is a total mess. Chips are WAY overpriced, there's only two poker tables total (!!!), the poker blinds go up super fast, rampant bugs, people losing chips they paid real money for (the devs are doing refunds but still- it shouldn't happen at all). The devs need to switch away from their income coming from chip sales, and more towards the cosmetics or something. The payment model as it is is NOT going to work. There is a solid game here, but it needs changes. Play some for free if you want, but I wouldn't suggest investing at this point. Changing my review to a 'no'. Sorry devs, but it's a mess right now.Everything below is only left for posterity, you can ignore it as it is completely outdated info_______________________edit 5/12/2015: Apparently the game has gone free now, just a few days after I purchased it. Bad timing on my part aside: The game now has a decent population going, and there's definitely no reason to not recommend picking it up, since it's free! Very solid game- the only real complaint I have is that poker blinds go up waaay too fast, but the devs have said they're looking into it._______________________________Since it is simply "YES" or "NO", I'm going "YES" here. But that's not really how I feel about it. There is a great, functional core here. But the game is empty. Very empty. In two hours I've seen a total of 5 other players, all but one of them were just at a slot machine and unresponsive to greetings. At some point, once there's some sort of population, I think this will be a great game. Right now I don't really see a reason to reccommend buying it.

content:
r 14, 2015
												From the ashes of Playstation Home comes The Four Kings Casino and Slots.When Home's closure was announced near the end of 2014 its 3rd party Devs, one of which was Digital Leisure, freaked out and quickly started up new projects since their easy cash stream was about to go bye-bye. Digital Leisure opted to turn their Paradise Springs Casino area into a stand alone game. So they rebuilt it and renamed it The Four Kings Casino and Slots. As an attempt to lure Home users to it they decided to try and emulate Home. Sadly though they decided to emulate Home as it was near the end of its life. So the game is a bit shoddy, users suggestions are ignored most of the time, and they're more interested pushing cash store vanity items that have sod all to do with a casino (like pets and doofy avatar zoning in and out animations).Like Playstaion Home was, this game is something that could be fun but is ruined by the cheap cash grab mentality of the Devs.Cannot recommend.

content:
1, 2015
												I have played this game quite a bit, and while fun I do think that it suffers from some major issues.First, the games are stacked into the casino's favor WAY more than a normal casino.  I know it sounds like I'm just being idiotic, but I started testing a few things in the game.  First, when playing slots you almost never hit bonuses. Once in 200 spins or so seems to be the average.  If you've ever been to a real casino, you know bonuses are a lot more common.  In fact the payout on the slot machines is ridiculous.  You can expect to lose 75% of the money you put into the slot machine over about 10 spins.  Slots are money losers, I know, but 75% over 10 spins, nine out of ten times? Come on.  Yes you can go on win streaks, but its as though when the game feels you have built up enough using a Martingale system (doubling your bet after you lose), it will make sure you keep losing.  You can go up to max bet and lose, which is normal using that system.  But to continue losing 10 more bets after that?Not convinced?  Blackjack.  I counted the number of cards between yellow cards.  Instead of the standard 6 decks.. there is 4.5.. not 4, not 5.. but 4.5.  So which cards are extra and who gets which? Go ahead, try it.  You can bet 15 times in a row using basic blackjack strat and not win a single round.  Meanwhile the dealer will pull 14, or 16.. and they will get just enough to beat you.Why?  Well, the problem is the whole pay-to-play structure.  While it would take a lengthy amount of time to lose your chips making minimum bets, you will never make VIP.  VIP allows you to play Baccarat (not available on the normal floor), as well as play higher stakes games, and a few other perks. You earn VIP status through earning Reward Points.  You earn Reward Points for winning bets.  The higher the bet, the more reward points you are eligible for.  It takes a lot of grinding.  So couple the fact with you need to win big bets (or play long nonsensical hours (probably 8 hours a day for minimum bets)) with the fact that the game in tilted more in the odds of the casino than a normal casino.. you come to the realization that if you enjoy playing the games enough you need to purchase chips.  I don't mind paying the developer for the game, I understand a developer deserves to get paid for their product.  But atleast make it fair.  If I spend money I want atleast a chance to win.  Either make us pay for the product, or find another way to make revenue.. because it sucks supporting a game by buying more chips, just to lose them on their broken system.  I'd rather not spend more than a set amount on a game without getting some actual content.  Just my opinion.

												While it currently has zero competition, there are a good number of reasons to avoid playing this game:1. Buggy, sometimes unplayable experiences that result in the loss of chips-in-play2. A considerable lack of variety in machine games3. The VIP room carrot-on-a-stickAllow me to shed some light on number three. There exists in the game a 'VIP' area unlocked for entry when you achieve a certain amount of 'RP' (your secondary form in-game currency used solely for purchasing aesthetic items). The amount of points required to unlock the 'VIP' room is absurd, so naturally I was curious as to what lay behind the golden gates. Could it be higher betting caps for machine games? Different, perhaps better machine game backgrounds than the machines in the pleb lobby? I needed to know. Also I was pretty tired of the ♥♥♥♥♥♥ castle slots characters.Took a month to get enough of the damned RP points only to walk in the 'VIP' room and be greeted with the same machines  with the same betting caps. Only difference was I could play Baccarat and a higher cap of Poker. Huge let down.Oh, and everyone was wearing a horse helmet. This games art direction needs a sharp kick in the ♥♥♥, early access or not.

content:
, 2015
												I haven't played too much of this, but it is very fun and takes place of WSOP in my casual card game list. This takes an approach that most games don't think about, we give you chips, you play, and if you want to play more you have to pay. Now in most circumstances I would not support microtransactions, but when they keep a stable game economy such as this they are tollerable. Someone doesn't have 5 million chips just from playing blackjack thousands of times, if they win or lose that keeps people playing, they have to accually play to get stuff, and if they pay for it, its not going to improve their chances of winning. I don't care if there are microtransactions if it is only useless cosmetics. Even an effect that made a 2X chips wouldn't be too much.The main thing is, as long as the microtransactions don't in any way impede the progress or fun of the people who don't pay, it ultimately doesn't hurt or help anyone. 8.5/10

number of helpful: 2 of 6 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
er 11, 2015
												Alright, let me start my review by stating that I'm going to cover each game that is within the Casino by bracket.  I'm going to be starting with Jacks or Better Video Poker as it will lay the foundation as to why nobody should waste the ten minutes it takes to install this game.Jacks or Better, Video Poker:First, if you get a Jack or better... It's not a push and you do not get your bet back.  Second, if you get a pair below Jack, you do not get credit for the pair.  Third and most importantly, it seems you only get a winning hand on average, once in every ten or so plays and usually that's just a pair or three of a kind.Slots:Okay, first of all the buy ins to play slots are insainly inflated.  You're talking 88-3,000 chips per spin.  When you play any of these brackets, the "big wins" or "jackpots" are squed.  I got a big win with a 3k buy in and the pot was 9,000 chips.  You would have to be insain to play slots in this game for an extended period of time.Video Blackjack:This is the only game that doesn't seem to be calibrated to destroy you.  The only game inside this casino I do not have  a poor review for... Yet..Keno:My only complaint about this game is that it seems as though your win ratio turns from 1 out of every 9 plays to 1 out of every 3 whenever this game becomes the daily.Big Wheel 6:This game seems to be working in the opposit fassion than it normally should.  Obviously, you should have a statistically higher chance of seeing a 1 or a 2 over any other number correct?  Yet, if you were to sit down and bet 5, 10, 20, J, and $ you would magically come out ahead almost every single time.  Isn't that curious?War:War is supposed to be a game that is literally 50% win ratio.  You're lucky to win 1 out of every 5 hands.  Unless of course, War happens to be the daily.  Then, you are magically coming out ahead always.  Outside of the daily, going to war is supposed to be a stistical 1/8 or so chance.  Yet, in this game.. I've averaged it with about 1/14 or so.  Isn't that curious?  What's crious is it seems to be almost exactly 1/7 when War is the daily. Huh??Baccarat:Just like war, a tie bet should be about 1 out of every 8 chances.  Yet, i've hand counted time and again that 90% of ties seem to occur between 12 and 16 times.  Maybe it's because they don't want someone who's rich enough to spam bet come out ahead?  Hmm?  Curious!Bingo:It seems you have a 25% chance every time you sit down for the table, your mouse, or something involved with the game in general to be buggy.  Outside of this, there seems to be all kinds of kinks and issues with the game that make it unplayable or slacking on a fun scale.  Lets not forget the insain buy ins to play a round of bingo however!  The progressive bingo games which have the biggest pots are 5 grand to buy in.  Most of the time, 20 people are playing.  You're going to lose that money.  Of course, the free buy ins only have about 3 grand for the pot.  True, you can argue that's because nobody is buying in.  But, can we expect the casino to fetch in some chips towards the pot? NOPE!!!Regular blackjack and single deck:Blackjack is one of those games that you should have the statistical advantage over the house simply because the dealer is forced against their will to hit until they reach 17 or higher or bust.  Yet, magically...  It is a mirricle to see the dealer bust in this game.  As a matter of fact, i've clocked blackjack busts to average for me one in every 12 hands.  Usually, some witchcraft occurs where the dealer will hit 7 times and get a perfect 21 more often than not.Roulette:Finally, we are now starting to talk about a Casino game I enjoy to play.  Why do I enjoy this?  Well, I believe myself to be keen with math and statistics.  I also enjoy the game in general and know many play styles.  However, the first thing to point out is that the dimonds on the table are backwords which automatically means more randomization for predictions.  Curious?  Then, there is what I like to call the conservative betting system.  You know?  The system where if you sat there 10 hours straight you'd come out ahead?  Bet on red, closest row, center row leaving you know? 4 blacks, 0-00, and the 8 reds minor loss?  I promise you if you did this system or its mirror, you will go bankrupt and FAST.  Isn't that curious?  Or when you happen to just spam the 50/50 bets and lose far more often than not.  Or you know, betting on seemingly anything and its seemingly elsewhere the ball finds itself no matter what you do?  You could say I'm a conspiricy therist with regards to roulette in this game but maybe some of my comments coming up will change your opinion.Poker:Oh yes, Poker...  There are 52 cards in a deck and four of each card with a different suit.  Nobody will argue this.  What I will however argue, is how I manage to get Queen with an off suit 2 through 7 twice at the same table, every single table I've ever played since I've installed this game.  Curious how that keeps happening, huh?  It's almost statistically impossible.  Yet, it keeps happening.  Craps:  Ah yes, save the best and favorite for last.  The game that the house doesn't have the advantage of.  This also just happens to be the one game that is the reason that I'm now out of chips entirely for the fourth time in a row.  Curious as to how it happened? So am I...  One of my favorite and also simplest bets to do is to simply min bet the come out roll like you should.  When it rolls and you are On, you simply bet three times the come out roll or more on the Don't come Bar, then you bet some chump change on craps, any 7, and 12.  This ensures that you lose a little change but are gurenteed to not lose money.  You roll and if it's on, the chips get moved to that number.  From there, you roll trying to get a 7 before you roll that number.  No matter how many times I do this, magically, I will lose.  I'm not just talking about once, but numorous times in a row for hours on end.  Just yesterday, I depletted 120 grand on this system.  One time in particular, I rolled a 7 to lose when I'm trying to get it ready to win... 9 times in a row... Curious how more things that shouldn't happen occur constanty in this game, huh?Tournoments:Ah yes, I entered the poker tournoment over a weekened two weekends ago.  I placed in this tournoment first with 166 seats.  Guess what the grand prize was for placing first?  14 whole grand.  That's right.  Sounds like it's missing a few zeros in that total?  You're telling me.Player base:Ah yes, the final topic about this game.  I'm right around my one month in marker from starting this game.  Yet, I'm globally ranked 96th as of this specific moment for this season.  I've been informed I'm over a month behind in the rankings and that they will end at the end of this month for season 2.  How come there are only 96 people ahead of me?  Well, you could argue that I'm good at gambling outside of when I hit magical, near impossible lose streaks.  Or, you could be observant and see that the halls are fairly empty most hours of the day.  Why?  Maybe it's because the chances of winning any game at this casino is far less than even one in real life.  Why is that?  Well, you can buy more chips with real life money and it seems to me, they designed this game so you lose chips and are put into a sitation where you have to buy more.  Thank you all for reading my review, post your hate all you want, I will love it.  Find me ingame to hate me more, I'm Hazereaper.  I'm sure you will find me losing at craps, winning tournoments for cents to the dollar.  I still have hope that maybe this game will turn around.  Regardless, the only reason I'm still playing this game is that I enjoy the Casino games but the moment I find better that doen't involve real life money, I'll move on.  Or, when I finally get sick enough to uninstall.

												I'll have to change my review, as this game was released in probably the worst state you could ever expect a game to be released in. Hackers on day one with access to every feature the game had to offer. It's an unfortunately greedy company preying on gambling addictions as you are paying the same price here to play games and not get anything from it as you would any other online casino. It's a legal loophole they're taking advantage of.Imagine a casino where they host daycare, and you have this game. It is taken over by little boys who run around spamming profanity because the filter makes it 'cool'. Expect the same type of people you would find in a game like League of Legends or CSGO. It's not a mature community, it's not a friendly community, and it's definitely not a social community like you might expect. Do not play unless you plan on giving away money to play imaginary casino games. Still overrun by hackers; people can see your cards in poker and there's nothing you can do to find out.
